Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.ui.secureinput

Interface SecureKeypadListenerEncrypted

public interface SecureKeypadListenerEncrypted
An interface that will get callbacks from the encrypted secure keypad when keypad buttons are pressed. This interface is used for OTP/Token with PIN authentication. To use Encrypted Secure Keypad for generic purpose, e.g. Application Password, use, SecureKeypadListenerClearText
Since:
6.2

  • Method Details

    • onKeyPressedCountChanged

      void onKeyPressedCountChanged(int newCount, int inputField)
      Called when user presses the encrypted secure keypad button and changes the number of PIN digits in the selected input field. Application could update custom UI accordingly to display how many digits has been entered for each input field.
      Parameters:
      newCount - PIN digits count for the selected input field.
      inputField - The current selected input field. 0 for the first input field, and 1 for the second input field.

    • onInputFieldSelected

      void onInputFieldSelected(int inputField)
      Called when the user interacts with the encrypted secure keypad and causes a focus change of the input field

      Note:
      This method is NOT triggered when input field is changed using the SecureInputUi.selectInputField(int) method.
      Parameters:
      inputField - The current selected input field. 0 for the first input field, and 1 for the second input field.

    • onOkButtonPressed

      void onOkButtonPressed()
      Called when the user interacts with the encrypted secure keypad by pressing the "OK" button.

    • onDeleteButtonPressed

      void onDeleteButtonPressed()
      Called when the user interacts with the encrypted secure keypad by pressing the "Delete" button.

    • onShiftButtonPressed

      void onShiftButtonPressed()
      Called when the user interacts with the encrypted secure keypad by pressing the "Shift" button.

    • onFinish

      void onFinish(EncryptedData encryptedData)
      This method is used to get the callback from encrypted secure keypad the user finished entry to notifies of encrypted key blobs. This can be invoked either when the user taps the visible and enabled OK button or when keypad internally simulates the OK button. password is not able to be extracted from this secure data object. It's important to be aware that the keypad itself will NOT perform any comparison of the two pin objects.
      Parameters:
      encryptedData - EncryptedData object that contains all encrypted key blobs and verification datagram. Can be null if the user didn't enter any key.

      Note:

      Encryption Mode = GEMALTO:

      Each key blob contains the 4 bytes UTF-32 (Big-Endian) value of corresponding key character displayed on the keypad. Each key blob is encrypted with RSA public key used to initialize the secure keypad.

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_AES:

      First key blob contains PIN with ISO 9564 Format 1, encrypted with AES key (PKCS#5 padding).

      Second key blob contains symmetric key encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding).

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_3DES:

      First key blob contains PIN with ISO 9564 Format 1, encrypted with 3DES key (No padding).

      Second key blob contains symmetric key encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding).

    • onError

      void onError(String errorMessage)
      Called when errors happened inside secure input.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - is the message that describes the error.
